section.title: The empty-root-directory element
section.para: The empty-root-directory element specifies a directory in the application's root/main output directory (in …/{application}/{version}/, not adding a usecase sub-directory). If such a directory already exists it will be emptied (unless you set @clear-target="false", which will only be necessary in very rare circumstances).

attribute.name: target-subdir
attribute.para: The name of the sub-directory to create.

attribute.name: directory-id
attribute.para: Defines the identifier for the sub-directory. See common attributes for a usage example.

attribute.name: compare
attribute.para: Whether this directory should be included in a comparison (with results from the original code).

attribute.name: compare-flags
attribute.para: Specific settings for comparing this directory with the results of the original code. See the description of these attributes for details.

attribute.name: clear-target
attribute.para: Whether to clear the target directory.
